intro: Lobelia blantyrensis, commonly known as the Blantyren lobelia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It has slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Lobelia blantyrensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
